footerDescription: Your trusted source for African diaspora articles and opportunities across Europe.

newsletter.subtitle: Your diaspora news & opportunities digest
newsletter.error: Failed to subscribe. Please try again.

about.title: About AfriEuropa News
about.subtitle: Connecting, informing, and empowering African diaspora communities across Europe through quality journalism and storytelling.

mission.title: Mission
mission.text: To bridge the information gap for African diaspora communities in Europe, providing news, opportunities, and stories that matter to our community.

community.title: Community
community.text: Building stronger connections within and across African diaspora communities.

global.title: Global Perspective
global.text: Connecting African diaspora experiences across European borders and beyond.

opportunities.title: Opportunities
opportunities.text: Highlighting career, education, and business opportunities for diaspora communities.

stories.title: Authentic Stories
stories.text: Sharing authentic voices and experiences that reflect our diverse community.

story.title: Story
story.p1: Founded in 2025, AfriEuropa News is the go-to platform for Africans living in Europe. Built by journalists, entrepreneurs, and community leaders from the diaspora, we tell the stories that matter—news, opportunities, and voices that reflect our everyday experiences.
story.p2: We exist to inform, connect, and celebrate African communities across Europe while bridging the gap between home and diaspora.
story.p3: Today, we serve over 50,000 readers across 15 European countries, providing daily news updates, weekly newsletters, and in-depth features that celebrate our community's achievements and address our challenges.

team.title: Our Team
team.subtitle: Meet the dedicated professionals bringing AfriEuropa’s vision to life
team.ceoBio: A seasoned journalist with over 10 years of experience in media, strategy, and storytelling. Henry leads AfriEuropa News with a vision of connecting African diaspora communities across Europe through accurate and impactful reporting.
team.cooBio: A creative product designer and storyteller passionate about user-centered design. Elizabeth specializes in creating meaningful digital experiences that amplify diaspora voices, with a strong focus on migration and cultural integration.
team.ctoBio: A dynamic journalist and event organizer dedicated to capturing authentic diaspora experiences. Hae-Won combines sharp writing skills with hands-on community engagement, bringing stories and events that resonate with Africans across Europe.

authenticity.title: Authenticity
authenticity.text: We tell authentic stories that reflect the real experiences of African diaspora communities, celebrating both struggles and successes.

excellence.title: Excellence
excellence.text: We maintain the highest standards of journalism, ensuring accuracy, fairness, and ethical reporting in all our content.

empowerment.title: Empowerment
empowerment.text: We empower our community by providing information, opportunities, and platforms that help individuals and communities thrive.

unity.title: Unity
unity.text: We foster unity and solidarity among African diaspora communities while celebrating our diversity and unique cultural contributions.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.intro: We’d love to hear from you.

form.title: Send a Message
form.success: Your message has been sent successfully!
form.error: Something went wrong. Please try again.

tips.title: Send Us Tips
tips.text: If you have news, stories, or tips, feel free to share them with us.

title: Editorial Policy
commitment: Our commitment to accurate, fair, and responsible journalism for the African diaspora in Europe.
missionText: We are committed to providing accurate, fair, and balanced news coverage that serves the African diaspora communities across Europe. We strive to inform, educate, and empower our readers with quality journalism that respects diversity and promotes understanding.
accuracyList: All facts are verified through multiple reliable sources
We distinguish clearly between news reporting and opinion pieces
Corrections are published promptly and prominently when errors occur
Sources are identified whenever possible, with anonymity granted only when necessary for safety or story validity
fairnessList: We present multiple perspectives on controversial issues
All parties affected by our reporting are given the opportunity to respond
We avoid stereotypes and generalizations about communities or individuals
Personal bias does not influence our news reporting
independenceList: Our editorial content is independent of commercial and political interests
Sponsored content is clearly labeled and separated from editorial content
We do not accept payment for editorial coverage
Conflicts of interest are disclosed transparently
culturalText: We are committed to reporting with cultural awareness and sensitivity. Our coverage respects the diversity of African diaspora experiences while avoiding generalizations that may misrepresent communities or individuals.
languageList: We use clear, accessible language appropriate for our diverse readership
Respectful tone is maintained in all content
Inflammatory or divisive language is avoided
Technical terms are explained when necessary
protectionText: We protect the identity of sources who request anonymity for legitimate reasons, including personal safety, legal concerns, or professional retaliation. Source confidentiality is taken seriously and maintained even under legal pressure.
developmentList: Story ideas are evaluated for relevance to our diaspora audience
Research and fact-checking are conducted before publication
Multiple sources are consulted for complex or controversial topics
Editorial review ensures adherence to our standards
oversightText: All content undergoes editorial review to ensure accuracy, clarity, and adherence to our editorial standards. The editorial team reserves the right to edit content for length, clarity, and editorial standards.
correctionsPolicyText: When errors are identified, we publish corrections promptly and prominently. Significant corrections are noted at the top of the corrected article with the date of correction.
feedbackText: We welcome reader feedback and take complaints seriously. Concerns about editorial content can be directed to our editorial team at editorial@afrieuropanews@gmail.com.
communityText: Comments and user-generated content must be respectful and constructive. We reserve the right to moderate or remove content that violates our community standards, including:
contactText: For editorial inquiries, story tips, or concerns about our coverage, please contact:

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.personalInfoText: We may collect the following personal information:
personalInfoList: Name and contact information (when you contact us)
autoInfoList: Pages visited and time spent on our site
useList: Deliver our newsletter and content updates
Respond to your inquiries and provide customer support
Improve our website and user experience
Analyze website traffic and usage patterns
privacy.sharingText: We do not sell, trade, or rent your personal information to third parties. We may share information only in the following circumstances:
sharingList: To comply with legal requirements or court orders
To protect our rights, privacy, safety, or property
With trusted service providers who assist in our operations (under strict confidentiality agreements)
privacy.cookiesText: We use cookies and similar technologies to enhance your browsing experience, analyze site traffic, and remember your preferences. You can control cookie settings through your browser preferences.
privacy.securityText: We implement appropriate security measures to protect your personal information against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction. However, no internet transmission is 100% secure, and we cannot guarantee absolute security.
privacy.rightsText: Under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), you have the right to:
rightsList: Restrict processing of your personal data
privacy.unsubscribeText: You can unsubscribe from our newsletter at any time by clicking the 'unsubscribe' link in any newsletter email or by contacting us directly at hello@afrieuropanews@gmail.com.
privacy.childrenText: Our services are not intended for children under 16 years of age. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under 16.
privacy.changesText: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page and updating the 'Last updated' date.
